alert.note: Alert for Dawes; North Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 5:47PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Dawes and northeastern Sioux Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 446 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Robinson Campground, or 27 miles west of Chadron, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fort Robinson Campground around 455 PM MDT. Crawford around 515 PM MDT. Whitney Lake around 530 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
